description: This template creates 2 Windows Active Directory Domain Controllers into private subnets in separate Availability Zones inside a VPC. The default Domain Administrator password will be the one retrieved from the instance.  For adding members to the domain, ensure that they are launched using the domain member security group created by this template and then configure them to use the AD instances fixed private IP addresses as the DNS server. **WARNING** This template creates Amazon EC2 Windows instance and related resources. You will be billed for the AWS resources used if you create a stack from this template. (qs-1qup6rae5)

templateBody.Description: This template creates 2 Windows Active Directory Domain Controllers into private subnets in separate Availability Zones inside a VPC. The default Domain Administrator password will be the one retrieved from the instance.  For adding members to the domain, ensure that they are launched using the domain member security group created by this template and then configure them to use the AD instances fixed private IP addresses as the DNS server. **WARNING** This template creates Amazon EC2 Windows instance and related resources. You will be billed for the AWS resources used if you create a stack from this template. (qs-1qup6rae5)

QuickStartDocumentation.EntrypointName: Parameters for deploying self-managed AD into an existing VPC

Label.default: Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services configuration
Microsoft Active Directory Certificate Services configuration

CaAmi.default: CA SSM Parameter Value for Latest AMI ID

CaValidityPeriodUnits.default: Enterprise Root or Subordinate CA Certificate Validity Period in Years

DataDriveSizeGiB.default: SYSVOL and NTDS Data Drive Size

DeletedObjectLifetime.default: Set new Deleted Objects Lifetime in Days

EntCaServerNetBIOSName.default: Enterprise Root or Subordinate CA NetBIOS Name

OrCaServerNetBIOSName.default: Offline Root CA NetBIOS Name (Only Used For Two Tier PKI)

OrCaValidityPeriodUnits.default: Offline Root CA Certificate Validity Period in Years (Only Used For Two Tier PKI)

TombstoneLifetime.default: Set new Tombstone Lifetime in Days

UseS3ForCRL.default: Use S3 for CA CRL Location

WINFULLBASE.default: SSM Parameter Value for Latest AMI ID

ADServer1InstanceType.Description: Amazon EC2 instance type for the first Active Directory Domain Controller instance

ADServer1NetBIOSName.Description: NetBIOS name of the first Active Directory Domain Controller (up to 15 characters)

ADServer1PrivateIP.Description: Fixed private IP for the first Active Directory Domain Controller located in Availability Zone 1

ADServer2InstanceType.Description: Amazon EC2 instance type for the second Active Directory Domain Controller instance

ADServer2NetBIOSName.Description: NetBIOS name of the second Active Directory Domain Controller (up to 15 characters)

ADServer2PrivateIP.Description: Fixed private IP for the second Active Directory Domain Controller located in Availability Zone 2

AppInsightsApplicationName.Description: Application name to be used with AppInsights monitoring

CaAmi.Description: Enterprise Root CA SSM Parameter Value to grab the latest AMI ID

CaDataDriveSizeGiB.Description: Size of the data drive in GiB for the CA instance(s)

CaHashAlgorithm.Description: CA(s) Hash Algorithm for Signing Certificates

CaServerInstanceType.Description: Amazon EC2 instance type for the CA instance(s)

CreateDefaultOUs.Description: Domain Elevated Accounts, Domain Users, Domain Computers, Domain Servers, Domain Service Accounts, and Domain Groups OUs and set the default users and computers containers to Domain Users and Domain Computers

DHCPOptionSet.Description: Do you want to create and apply a new DHCP Options Set

DataDriveSizeGiB.Description: Size of SYSVOL and NTDS data drive in GiB

DeletedObjectLifetime.Description: The number of days before a deleted object is removed from the Active Directory recycle bin, minimum number is 2

DomainAdminPassword.Description: Password for the account named above. Must be at least 8 characters containing letters, numbers and symbols

DomainAdminUser.Description: User name for the account that will be added as a Domain Administrator. This is separate from the default "Administrator" account

DomainDNSName.Description: Fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the forest root domain e.g. example.com

DomainNetBIOSName.Description: NetBIOS name of the domain (up to 15 characters) for users of earlier versions of Windows e.g. EXAMPLE

EbsEncryptionKmsKeyId.Description: The identifier of the AWS KMS key to use for Amazon EBS encryption. You can specify the KMS key using any of the following; Key ID, Key alias, Key ARN, Alias ARN

EnableAdvancedAudtingandMetrics.Description: Enable advanced auditing and metrics and upload them to CloudWatch using the Amazon Kinesis Agent for Microsoft Windows

EntCaServerNetBIOSName.Description: NetBIOS name of the Enterprise Root or Subordinate CA server (up to 15 characters)

KeyPairName.Description: Public/private key pairs allow you to securely connect to your instance after it launches

OrCaServerNetBIOSName.Description: NetBIOS name of the Offline Root CA server (Only Used For Two Tier PKI) (up to 15 characters)

OrCaValidityPeriodUnits.Description: Validity Period in Years (Only Used For Two Tier PKI)

PKI.Description: Deploy Two Tier (Offline Root with Subordinate Enterprise CA) or One Tier (Enterprise Root CA) PKI Infrastructure

PrivateSubnet1ID.Description: ID of subnet 1 in Availability Zone 1 (e.g., subnet-a0246dcd)

PrivateSubnet2ID.Description: ID of subnet 2 in Availability Zone 2 (e.g., subnet-a0246dcd)

QSS3BucketName.ConstraintDescription: Quick Start bucket name can include numbers, lowercase letters, uppercase letters, and hyphens (-). It cannot start or end with a hyphen (-).
QSS3BucketName.Description: S3 bucket name for the Quick Start assets. Quick Start bucket name can include numbers, lowercase letters, uppercase letters, and hyphens (-). It cannot start or end with a hyphen (-).

QSS3BucketRegion.Description: The AWS Region where the Quick Start S3 bucket (QSS3BucketName) is hosted. When using your own bucket, you must specify this value

QSS3KeyPrefix.ConstraintDescription: Quick Start key prefix can include numbers, lowercase letters, uppercase letters, hyphens (-), and forward slash (/)
QSS3KeyPrefix.Description: S3 key prefix for the Quick Start assets. Quick Start key prefix can include numbers, lowercase letters, uppercase letters, hyphens (-), and forward slash (/)

S3CRLBucketName.Description: S3 bucket name for CA CRL(s) storage. Bucket name can include numbers, lowercase letters, uppercase letters, and hyphens (-). It cannot start or end with a hyphen (-)

TombstoneLifetime.Description: The number of days before a deleted object is removed from Active Directory, minimum number is 2

UseS3ForCRL.Description: Store CA CRL(s) in an S3 bucket

VPCCIDR.ConstraintDescription: CIDR block parameter must be in the form x.x.x.x/16-28

WINFULLBASE.Description: System Manager parameter value for latest Windows Server AMI

Assertions.AssertDescription: All subnets must in the VPC
CRL BucketName cannot must be valid BucketName

ADServer1NetBIOSName.description: NetBIOS name of the first Active Directory Domain Controller (up to 15 characters)

ADServer1PrivateIP.description: Fixed private IP for the first Active Directory Domain Controller located in Availability Zone 1

ADServer2NetBIOSName.description: NetBIOS name of the second Active Directory Domain Controller (up to 15 characters)

ADServer2PrivateIP.description: Fixed private IP for the second Active Directory Domain Controller located in Availability Zone 2

ADAdminSecParamName.description: AWS Secrets Parameter Name that has Password and User namer for the built-in administrator

ADAltUserSecParamName.description: AWS Secrets Parameter Name for the account that will be added as Domain Administrator. This is separate from the built-in Administrator account

RestoreModeSecParamName.description: AWS Secrets Parameter Name for the Active Directory Restore Mode Password

DomainDNSName.description: Fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the forest root domain e.g. example.com

DomainNetBIOSName.description: NetBIOS name of the domain (up to 15 characters) for users of earlier versions of Windows e.g. EXAMPLE

CreateDefaultOUs.description: Create Domain Elevated Accounts, Domain Users, Domain Computers, Domain Servers, Domain Service Accounts, and Domain Groups OUs

TombstoneLifetime.description: The number of days before a deleted object is removed from the directory services

DeletedObjectLifetime.description: The number of days before a deleted object is removed from the directory services recycling bin

QSS3BucketName.description: S3 bucket name for the Quick Start assets. Quick Start bucket name can include numbers, lowercase letters, uppercase letters, and hyphens (-). It cannot start or end with a hyphen (-)

QSS3BucketRegion.description: The AWS Region where the Quick Start S3 bucket (QSS3BucketName) is hosted. When using your own bucket, you must specify this value

QSS3KeyPrefix.description: S3 key prefix for the Quick Start assets. Quick Start key prefix can include numbers, lowercase letters, uppercase letters, hyphens (-), and forward slash (/)

StackName.description: Stack Name Input for cfn resource signal

Properties.Description: Administrator Password for AD Quick Start
Restore Mode Password for AD Quick Start
Alternate AD Admin User from AD Quick Start

Fn::Sub:
<powershell>
$Params = @{
    ADAdminSecParamName = '${ADAdminSecrets}'
    ADServer1NetBIOSName = '${ADServer1NetBIOSName}'
    ADServer1PrivateIP = '${ADServer1PrivateIP}'
    ADServer2NetBIOSName = '${ADServer2NetBIOSName}'
    ADServer2PrivateIP = '${ADServer2PrivateIP}'
    ADAltUserSecParamName = '${ADAltUserSecrets}'
    CreateDefaultOUs = '${CreateDefaultOUs}'
    DeletedObjectLifetime = '${DeletedObjectLifetime}'
    DomainDNSName = '${DomainDNSName}'
    DomainNetBIOSName = '${DomainNetBIOSName}'
    EnableAdvancedAudtingandMetrics = '${EnableAdvancedAudtingandMetrics}'
    RestoreModeSecParamName = '${RestoreModeSecrets}'
    QSS3BucketName = '${QSS3BucketName}'
    QSS3BucketRegion =  '${QSS3BucketRegion}'
    QSS3KeyPrefix = '${QSS3KeyPrefix}'
    StackName = '${AWS::StackName}'
    TombstoneLifetime = '${TombstoneLifetime}'
    URLSuffix = '${AWS::URLSuffix}'
    VPCCIDR = '${VPCCIDR}'
}
Start-SSMAutomationExecution -DocumentName '${AWSQuickstartActiveDirectoryDS}' -Parameter $Params
</powershell>

Properties.Description: Security Group Rule between Domain Controllers
